{{short description|American political cartoonist and author|bot=PearBOT 5}} '''Sean Delonas''' is an [[United States|American]] [[political cartoonist]] and author whose work was for 23 years published by the ''[[New York Post]]'' as part of their [[Page Six]] content. His cartoons are currently syndicated worldwide by Cagle Cartoons.
==Life and career== Delonas graduated from the [[New York Academy of Art]].<ref name="hoffman2006">Hoffman, Bill (February 9, 2006). [https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/nypost/access/987263801.html?dids=987263801:987263801&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:FT&type=current&date=Feb+09%2C+2006&author=BILL+HOFFMANN&pub=New+York+Post&desc=MONSTER+IN+A+BOX+-+LESS+A+CARTOON+PANEL+ON+PAGE+SIX+THAN+A+CAGE+FOR+HIS+DAILY+VICTIMS%2C+SEAN+DELONAS+ART+TAKES+PLENTY+OF+PRISONERS.+HERE+ARE+SIX+OF+HIS+BEST.&pqatl=google Monster in a Box.] ''[[New York Post]]''</ref> Delonas is author of the [[children's book]] ''Scuttle's Big Wish'' (a retelling of the story of [[King Midas]]),<ref name="delonas2006">Delonas, Sean (2006). ''Scuttle's Big Wish.'' HarperCollins, {{ISBN|978-0-06-072645-4}}</ref> "Sean Delonas: The Ones They Didn't Print and Some of the Ones They Did." Skyhorse Publishing (2015).{{ISBN|978-1632203656}} [https://www.amazon.com/Sean-Delonas-Didnt-Print-Cartoons/dp/1632203650/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1543731853&sr=1-1&refinements=p_27%3ASean+Delonas] and ''Jackie Mason & Raoul Felder's Survival Guide to New York City''.<ref name="mason1997">Mason, Jackie and Raoul Lionel Felder (1997). ''Jackie Mason & Raoul Felder's Survival Guide to New York City.'' Avon Books, {{ISBN|978-0-380-97483-2}}</ref> His work has also appeared on the cover of another [[Rupert Murdoch]]-owned publication, ''[[The Weekly Standard]]''.<ref name="colford1998">Colford, Paul D. (February 5, 1998). [https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/latimes/access/25916215.html Conservative Journals Are Yukking It Up.] ''[[Los Angeles Times]]''</ref> He painted the altar [[triptych]] for the [[St. Agnes' Church (New York City)|Church of St. Agnes]] in New York.<ref name="landman1998">Beth Landman & Deborah Mitchell (February 16, 1998). [http://nymag.com/nymetro/news/people/columns/intelligencer/2185/ Delonas's Saints of Circumstance] ''[[New York Magazine]]''</ref>
==Controversies== A number of his cartoons have been criticized as "racist, offensive, and misleading."<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=https://www.salon.com/2018/02/08/albuquerque-newspaper-apologizes-for-obviously-racist-cartoon-attacking-dreamers/|title=Albuquerque newspaper apologizes for "obviously racist" cartoon attacking Dreamers|date=2018-02-08|work=Salon|access-date=2018-02-09|language=en-US}}</ref> His work has been criticized as "ham-handed",<ref name="Grossberger2001">Grossberger, Lewis (October 29, 2001). [http://www.mediaweek.com/mw/google/article_brief/1089669 Beware News Abuse.] ''[[Mediaweek]]''</ref> and he has been accused of "churning out malevolent fantasies."<ref name="cotts2001">Cotts, Cynthia (October 30, 2001). [http://www.villagevoice.com/2001-10-30/news/big-brother-s-reason-to-fear/1 Big Brother’s 'Reason' to Fear.] ''[[Village Voice]]''</ref> He has been called "the worst cartoonist on the planet" by ''Vanity Fair,'' which also asked if he was "stupid, racist, or both?"<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2009/02/sean-delonas-stupid-racist-or-both|title=Sean Delonas: Stupid, Racist, or Both?|last=Sancton|first=Julian|work=The Hive|access-date=2018-02-09|language=en}}</ref> Conversely, ''[[Commentary (magazine)|Commentary]]'' also praised his irreverent visual imagination, and described as "a bizarre cross between [[Jack Davis (cartoonist)|Jack Davis]] of ''[[Mad Magazine]]'' and [[Hieronymous Bosch]]."<ref>[http://www.commentarymagazine.com/article/cartooning-left-and-right/ Michael J. Lewis (October 2003)]</ref>
A 1999 cartoon depicted [[Louis Farrakhan]] about to undergo surgery for recently diagnosed cancer, with the surgeons preparing to cut through his neck to remove "the cancerous tumor from Farrakhan's body."<ref name="kurtz1999">Kurtz, Howard (March 29, 1999). [https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/washingtonpost/access/40135483.html Report of a Death, Slightly Exaggerated.] ''[[Washington Post]]''</ref> A 2001 cartoon showing rival editor [[Mortimer B. Zuckerman]] of the ''New York Daily News'' sending [[anthrax]] to ''Post'' editor [[Col Allan]] led to sponsor withdrawal.<ref name="blair2001">Blair, Jayson (October 24, 2001). Ads Withdrawn From The Post As Criticism of Anthrax Cartoon. ''[[New York Times]]''</ref>
After a photoshopped picture of the [[Sesame Street]] muppet [[Bert (Sesame Street)|Bert]] standing alongside [[Osama bin Laden]] went viral when it turned up on a pro-Osama placard, the website which included it ([[Bert is Evil]]) was taken down. Referencing this, in the ''Post'', Delonas did a series of depictions of Bert instructing and training [[Taliban]] and [[Al Qaida]] terrorists.{{citation needed|date=September 2014}}
In 2009, two days after a local [[Travis (chimpanzee)|chimpanzee mauling]]<ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/2009/02/17/nyregion/17chimp.html "Pet Chimp Is Killed After Mauling Woman"]</ref> and one day after legislation was signed into law by President [[Barack Obama]],<ref>{{cite news|title='Racist' US cartoon causes stir|publisher=BBC News|date=19 February 2009|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/7898845.stm|accessdate=2009-02-19}}</ref> Delonas depicted two white police officers who just shot and killed a [[Common chimpanzee|chimpanzee]]. One officer says, "They'll have to find someone else to write the next [[American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009|stimulus bill]]."<ref name="delonaschimp">Delonas, Sean (February 18, 2009). [http://www.nypost.com/delonas/2009/02/02182009.jpg Chimpanzee cartoon.] ''[[New York Post]]''</ref> The cartoon was widely criticized as in bad taste<ref name=CNN021809c>Roland S. Martin, [http://www.cnn.com/2009/POLITICS/02/18/martin.cartoon/index.html Commentary: NY Post cartoon is racist and careless], CNN, February 18, 2009, Accessed February 19, 2009.</ref> and as making a reference to the racial slur of African Americans being portrayed as apes. Protests came from journalists,<ref name=NBCNY021809c>Gabe Pressman, [https://web.archive.org/web/20090224010952/http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/29263562/ The Unfunny Cartoon], MSNBC.com, February 18, 2009, Accessed February 19, 2009.</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2009/POLITICS/02/18/martin.cartoon/index.html |publisher=CNN |title=Commentary: NY Post cartoon is racist and careless |date=February 18, 2009 |accessdate=May 23, 2010}}</ref><ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20090224010952/http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/29263562/ NBC News]</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.boston.com/news/nation/articles/2009/02/19/sebelius_may_fill_void_in_cabinet/ |work=The Boston Globe |title=Sebelius may fill void in Cabinet |date=February 19, 2009}}</ref> politicians,<ref>[http://cityroom.blogs.nytimes.com/2009/02/18/chimp-stimulus-cartoon-raises-racism-concerns/?hp "Chimp-Stimulus Cartoon Raises Racism Concerns"]</ref><ref>http://www.ny1.com/content/top_stories/94217/more-protest-planned-over-new-york-post-cartoon/Default.aspx</ref> police groups,<ref name=NYDN021909c>Simone Weichselbaum, [http://www.nydailynews.com/ny_local/2009/02/18/2009-02-18_new_york_post_chimpanzee_stimulus_cartoo.html New York Post chimpanzee stimulus cartoon draws cops' ire], ''New York Daily News'', February 19, 2009, Accessed February 19, 2009.</ref><ref name="Weichselbaum">{{cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/ny_local/2009/02/18/2009-02-18_new_york_post_chimpanzee_stimulus_cartoo.html |location=New York |work=Daily News |title=New York Post chimpanzee stimulus cartoon draws cops' ire |first=Simone |last=Weichselbaum |date=February 19, 2009}}</ref><ref name="Weichselbaum"/> and the public.<ref name=Times021909c>Nico Hines, [http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/us_and_americas/article5766822.ece Protesters picket New York Post over chimp cartoon], ''The Times'', February 19, 2009, Accessed February 19, 2009.</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Protesters picket New York Post over chimp cartoon |first=Nico |last=Hines |work=[[Times Online]] |date=February 19, 2009 |url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/us_and_americas/article5766822.ece |location=London}}</ref> The ''Post'' disputed this interpretation and defended Delonas.<ref name=CNN021909c>Ashley Fantz, [http://www.cnn.com/2009/US/02/19/chimp.cartoon.react/?iref=mpstoryview Racism row over chimp cartoon sparks debate], CNN, February 19, 2009, Accessed February 19, 2009.</ref> The ''Post'' apologized "to those who were offended by the image" while in the same statement accusing "some in the media" of seizing on the opportunity for "payback".<ref name="postapology">Editor (February 20, 2009). [http://www.nypost.com/seven/02192009/postopinion/editorials/that_cartoon_155984.htm That cartoon.] ''[[New York Post]]''</ref>
In 2018, the ''[[Albuquerque Journal]]'' apologized for publishing a cartoon by Delonas which equated [[MS-13]] gang members with [[DREAM Act|Dreamers]]. The cartoon was widely criticized, including by both US Senators from New Mexico.<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/08/us/dreamers-cartoon-albuquerque-journal.html|title=New Mexico Newspaper Apologizes for Cartoon Portraying ‘Dreamers’ as Muggers|last=Romero|first=Simon|date=2018-02-08|work=The New York Times|access-date=2018-02-09|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.politico.com/story/2018/02/09/albuquerque-journal-apologizes-cartoon-400997|title=Albuquerque Journal apologizes for racially-charged cartoon|work=POLITICO|access-date=2018-02-09}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://thehill.com/blogs/blog-briefing-room/news/372977-new-mexico-senators-blast-heinous-newspaper-cartoon-depicting|title=New Mexico senators blast 'heinous' cartoon depicting Dreamers as gang members|last=Gstalter|first=Morgan|date=2018-02-08|work=The Hill|access-date=2018-02-09|language=en}}</ref>
